After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.EXPLANATION: Average time required to replenish parts from the point of order to delivery, indicating the efficiency of the parts replenishment process.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.FORMULA: Average Time Taken from Order Placement to Parts Replenishment

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.EXPLANATION: Percentage of time that parts are available for use or sale compared to the total demand, reflecting inventory management effectiveness.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.FORMULA: (Number of Available Parts / Total Number of Parts) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.EXPLANATION: Percentage of parts that become obsolete or unsellable over a specific period, indicating inventory management and forecasting effectiveness.
Average cost incurred for processing and fulfilling each parts order, including procurement, logistics, and administrative expenses.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.FORMULA: Total Replenishment Cost / Total Number of Orders

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.EXPLANATION: Measure of how accurately future parts demand is predicted compared to actual demand, calculated through forecast versus actual demand data.
Measure of the reduction in variability of parts lead time, indicating improvements in the reliability of the parts supply chain.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.FORMULA: (Previous Lead Time Variance - Current Lead Time Variance) / Previous Lead Time Variance * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.KPIS: Parts replenishment compliance with service level agreements.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.EXPLANATION: Degree to which parts replenishment processes meet agreed-upon service levels, measured through performance against SLA targets.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.FORMULA: (Number of Compliant Replenishments / Total Number of Replenishments) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.EXPLANATION: Rate of improvements made to the efficiency of the parts replenishment process, measured by improvements in cycle time, cost, and accuracy.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics+Parts.FORMULA: (Previous Replenishment Efficiency - Current Replenishment Efficiency) / Previous Replenishment Efficiency * 100
